venue.name: Emerson Umbrella Center for the Arts

item.description:
Dear Boston Volunteers,

Lets welcome the new organization, Emerson Umbrella Center for the Arts located in Concord, MA. This is a good opportunity for our Boston volunteers to involve in field of art.

Please check their website for more information:

http://www.emersonumbrella.org

We are seeking two volunteers for the upcoming shows in October and November, we eventually are expecting more group events with this organization:

NOTE: THERE ARE 14 SHOWS THIS SEASON, YOU CAN SIGN-UP FOR ANY EVENT BASED ON YOUR AVAILABILITY.

Usher and see the show:  The Rocky Horror Show

 

THE ROCKY HORROR SHOW -

Richard O'Brien's cult classic returns to the Emerson Umbrella with cast members from our award nominated 2010 production and some fresh faces all ready to do the Time Warp again!

What: Ushers take tickets and give out programs before the performance. They get to see the show for free.

When: Performances on October 30 at 8 PM.

Future Events :  November 2 at 8 pm, November 3 at 7 pm AND 10 pm (Please sign up on the corresponding event page)

I can give you a ride from Boston on October 27 and November 3 at 7 PM. If not The commuter rail is about a 5 minute walk from our building and we have ample free parking. See http://www.mbta.com/schedules_and_maps/rail/lines/stations/?stopId=52 for more details.

Ushers arrive 1 hour before show time and stay to help pick up after the show.

Where: Emerson Umbrella Center for the Arts, 40 Stow Street, Concord (Concord Center) MA  * Ample free parking

Contact: Kathy Warren, Volunteer Coordinator at kwarren@emersonumbrella.org or call 978.371.0820 or me @ 505-301-6872 if you are lost or need additional information.

For more information see http://www.emersonumbrella.org/theater/our-current-production/

 

FUTURE VOLUNTEERING OPPORTUNITIES: Usher and see the show:  NEXT TO NORMAL

 

November 9 to 24 2012

 

NEXT TO NORMAL

 

Winner of 3 Tony Awards and the Pulitzer Prize for Drama, this fresh-off-Broadway hit is sure to give audiences a one-of-a-kind experience with some of the best local performers and musicians.

What: Ushers take tickets and give out programs before the performance. They get to see the show for free. Teens can earn community service hours.


Available Slots: November 9, 10, 16, 17, 23 and 24 at 8 pm  November 18 and 24 at 3 pm (See corresponding event pages on the Boston Volunteers Calender)

Thanks

Phani

The Boston Volunteers

Big Enough to Deliver, Small Enough to Care
Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org

Please friend Boston Volunteers Mascot- Paulette: http://on.fb.me/Of9QbB

Connect with your fellow Boston Volunteers
http://www.facebook.com/BostonVolunteers
Discover exclusive Boston Volunteer opportunities:
https://twitter.com/#!/BostonVolunteer

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: THE ROCKY HORROR SHOW-Usher and watch the show for free
